title: Other Aurelion Sol nerf?
body:
> **Celestial Expansion (W) **
> 
> * Passive's star base damage lowered to 5/10/15/20/25 from 10/20/30/40/50
> * Mana cost per second changed to 22/24/26/28/30 from 16/22/28/34/40

I know his winrate for expert players is really high but it's also true that he is not an everyday pick which means that the high win rate is because he is played by dedicated mains in favorable matchups (abysmal pickrate). The mana cost isn't going to balance it.

Unless there are other reasons behind this (in which case I'd like to hear them) except for raw stats I see this nerf completely undeserved.

Edit: Adding Meddler full change list. In the end there is a nice QoL on E and some damage is going to be dragged into the passive damage, with the mana cost reduction this might result in higher damage late game.

> **P - Center of the Universe**
> 
> * Damage:: 20-97 >>> 20-130
> 
>
> **E - Comet of Legend**
> 
> * Escape Velocity removed, can now be cast at any time outside of combat. Goes on short cooldown when taking champion/tower damage.
> Can no longer click to cancel, only cancelled with E recast.
> Now casts immediately, even if outside of cast range.

replies.body: I expect there just testing the "breaking" point for Ao Shin and this wont be in the offical live update. I mean they would be cutting his star dmg by 50%

Yeah, didn't notice it before, but the changes posted above are only a partial change list. I'm assuming issues with PBE scrapping. Full list (still in testing) below. Main thing to note is that while his W bonus damage is getting cut damage is getting added to the damage from his passive, so it's a nerf in many but not all points of the game to star damage (and technically a slight buff late game).


 P - Center of the Universe
 Damage:: 20-97 >>> 20-130

 W - Celestial Expansion
Bonus Damage:: 10 / 20 / 30 / 40 / 50 >>> 5 / 10 / 15 / 20 / 25
Persistent Mana Cost:: 16 / 22 / 28 / 34 / 40 per second >>> 22 / 24 / 26 / 28 / 30 per second

E - Comet of Legend
Escape Velocity removed, can now be cast at any time outside of combat. Goes on short cooldown when taking  champion/tower damage.
Can no longer click to cancel, only cancelled with E recast.
Now casts immediately, even if outside of cast range.
Ah, the buffs and QoLs weren't listed. Why dont we have offical PBE path notes? Like it could just be a sticky thread on the pbe forums

So far we've avoided putting time into PBE patch notes because we'd rather use that time on development for the patch instead. Third party sites like S@20 aren't perfect, but they're very close most of the time, so the slight improvement in tester feedback and player discussion's likely to be pretty small.

Have you guys considered hiring moobeat just to continue doing what he does? He might appreciate it and i'm sure the community would appreciate having them up right away every day instead of having WIP for a few hours every time while he sorts through the changes. You shouldn't need to divert developer resources in order to do that....
That guy is right, hire him :D

But you guys should already have an internal list of changes/pbe patchnotes being pushed forward floating around, it shouldnt be that hard to set up a page that shares that kind of information so that the PBE and non PBE players that want to know what changes are coming up can be informed so they can provide the appropriate feedback on the changes. 

Even if it is not 100% polished like official patch notes for each new official patch, they should mostly cover all the edge cases of S@20 or similar sites not being able to scrape all the info related to the changes. Not to mention that such sites would be able to communicate the changes to the player base in a much better and more accurate fashion instead of guesswork and speculation. Its not like people are going to stop visiting S@20, but S@20 and similar sites will be able to provide much more accurate info to the public which will lead to better feedback in the end.
Why would you do that? Have notes for the patch day. All you need. PBE stuff can be changed at any time so why make notes for it when Patch day isn't just sufficient, but the best way to do it?
Meddler, sorry to hijack this thread, but can I ask for the context behind giving Mundo Grievous Wounds on his Q. It just seems incredibly random.
Was an investigation into giving him a clearer niche. Believe we're pulling it, Mundo needs a bit of help but that's likely not the right approach.

Some sort of combo with Q into E would interesting since you pretty much put a huge gash in someone when you throw a rusty cleaver at them. Makes him less annoying poke wise and has to follow up a bit for bonuses.

It sounded awful and scary. He would become an unduelable monster.
If you're really looking to go the Grievous Wounds route with him, maybe you could make it a combo thing. Something like add GW to his E, but only when his W is toggled on or something.

What about this idea: when mundo hits a champ with a Q he puts a stack (a knife) on his enemy. Stacks lasts x time, others mundo's Q on the same target add more stacks and reset timer. If mundo get to the target, with the first aa after his E he can extract all the knives in a bloodbath getting some nice bonus (damage and/or enemy cc depending on how many stacks). This should be funny, a buff to his gameplay and it fits well with his crazy horror butcher style.

I've got roughly 350 ranked games in on Aurelion now and I really REALLY feel the immediate cast instead of the current method is not a good change. When I am playing him, I will 99% of the time cast my E where I want to end up, and having the fly start immediately would make it a lot harder to judge where I can fly to unless I look at the indicator. Especially in late game, if I want to fly far to make a big Q, I don't want to misjudge where my fly will end because I could stop short and really mess things up{{champion:32}}

The removal of escape velocity seems kinda weird too but I guess that its more of a neutral change than a nerf or buff. 

I like the E only end of the fly, but to an extent. Usually I will end a fly (when ganking) by clicking an enemy champ to attack them. Is the fly not going to stop if I issue an attack command?

I agree. The ability can't be used in combat (which i actually think is stupid because when they change it i won't be able to use E to dodge anything after harassing anymore.) anyway so it shouldn't suffer from the 'I need to cast right now to escape!' issue (kinda like what i mentioned in those brackets)

We'll probably do a second pass on that sort of quality of life stuff at some point. What in particular do you find makes aiming the Q tough in those circumstances?
so does this mean he doesn't gain movement speed moving in a straight line anymore?
The E passive is unchanged, the way you access the Active is different.

While on the subject of his E

> Now casts immediately, even if outside of cast range.

It's not that the Q is tough to aim per se, it's that a tiny tiny difference in angle ends up being a huuuge difference when you're travelling halfway across the map. Not sure how to fix that without making him only able to Q forward though.

Only Qing forward while Eing, or at least Q directly forward if you cast within a certain arc, might be a reasonable approach given there's already a lot of execution challenge and telegraph on the E itself. I'll bounce the thought off the folks working on these changes.

I wouldn't like the arc limitation. Time to time I have to use it 90 degrees from my E direction. I don't know if it would be too OP but I think a chance to fix the direction during the flight would be the best solution.

He was saying if you're mid-E, it would cast straight forward if you cast it within somewhere around a 10 degree arc, as its pretty damn likely your intention is straight forward in that case anyway.

As far as readjusting trajectory...no. Absolutely not.

Hello, The problem is that i (sol player) typically use the minimap to direct my star and the game for my E, then i let the star get in front of me so it leads (improving my position when i arrive) but usually once it gets near the edge of my outerlimit, ANY slight deviation can detonate it prematurely. You should make a line behind the star (like a trail of stars) that way we can better see the angle we need to hit. Simply adding a mechanic that matches the angle of the star would help too (Pressing e on the star's core should 0 the angle of the star, rather than the position from sol to cursor). I have never had an issue with casting mid-e.

My problem is figuring out where to click when flying. There are times when I click right in front of Sol but the star ends up flying right beside me instead. I click a little too far back and the star goes flying behind me. It feels to me like its a 1 unit difference between "Ok thats not exactly where i wanted it but its close enough" and "Welp my star just shot away, there goes my play".
The solution is to click the furthest possible. The further you click, the least difference in angle there is between two points within your error margin.

Hi! I just wanted to share my opinion on this: Aurelion Sol's pickrate is so low and his winrate is high only on people with 125+games on him, this means that what contributes to this guy's high winrate is the "surprise factor" and people still having to master the matchup.
Sol has clear strenght and weaknesses and that's what makes him balanced imo, his strenght is all about roaming and making plays across the map in the early game as he falls off pretty hard in the lategame (he's not at all a late game champ), and hitting that this hard will for sure make his winrate drop by a ton (and I'm barely at 52% ç_ç) whilst keeping his weaknesses intact.
In fact you CANNOT play and hope to win with Sol if u don't snowball HARD the game 'cause certain champions will always make u useless if the teams are close in gold value (Yasuo, Fizz, Kassadin) and we would be left with a champion with little strenghts as he wouldnt be able to shove as good anymore AND he really does little with that late-game dmg buff.
Furthermore, if people realize the strategy behind Sol and counteracts to it (jungler lv2-3 gank while he's shoving at first, counterroams, picks on his roaming, counterpicks, efficient ward placement) his winrate could see a decreasy as its not like his teamfighting/skirmishing is as good as many other mages (or champions in general). I think you could try to wait for this changes until next patch and see how his winrate goes (after all this should be the worlds patch); I love Sol but just when I became decent with him my winrate got hit hard by counterpicks and unlucky throws as u cannot solo carry with this champ, u NEED your team (and there are several replays of pro Sol's  having tons of killd and assists with crazy high kill partecipation but still losing.
Sol does not deals tons of dmg but he is always useful to the team, nerfing his dmg more will basically make him a suppor-like midlanert, and that feels bad on a celestial dragon.
ohh I'm liking the change to E that looks good since it will make him less clunky

At first I really didn't like the sound of these changes, but upon further inspection I think these changes aren't too bad. It looks like its just trying to slightly nerf his early game wave clear.

Here, I did some math.

Let's say the {{champion:136}} in this situation has 300 AP total

Current damage:

	Passive: 97+50 = 147 base damage (max W rank) + 35% AP (105) = 252 total damage

New     damage:

	Passive: 130+25 = 155 base damage (max W rank) + 35% AP (105) = 260 total damage

So it actually is a buff! I feel much better figuring this out. So it's a 25 damage nerf in the early game, but mid-to-late it's a very tiny buff. He'll still perform just fine, and if you're good with him and play smart till then you can take advantage of the very tiny buff.
